Class UpdateFlight

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.bookingsystem.commands.UpdateFlight
All Implemented Interfaces:
Command
public class UpdateFlight extends Object implements Command
The UpdateFlight class implements the Command interface and allows for updating the details of an existing flight in the system.

Only non-null and valid parameters are applied, allowing partial updates to flight attributes. The flight is persisted to the data store after successful update.

Author:
ashok

  • Constructor Details

    • UpdateFlight

      public UpdateFlight(int flightId, String newFlightNumber, String newOrigin, String newDestination, LocalDate newDepartureDate, Integer newEconomyCapacity, Integer newBusinessCapacity, Integer newFirstCapacity, Double newEconomyPrice, Double newBusinessPrice, Double newFirstPrice, FlightStatus newStatus, String newAirlineName, Boolean isInternational, LocalDate newArrivalDate, LocalTime newArrivalTime, LocalTime newDepartureTime)
      Constructs an UpdateFlight command with specified fields to update. Fields left as null (or negative values for capacities/prices) will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      flightId - the ID of the flight to update
      newFlightNumber - the new flight number (optional)
      newOrigin - the new origin location (optional)
      newDestination - the new destination location (optional)
      newDepartureDate - the new departure date (optional)
      newEconomyCapacity - the new economy class seat capacity (optional)
      newBusinessCapacity - the new business class seat capacity (optional)
      newFirstCapacity - the new first class seat capacity (optional)
      newEconomyPrice - the new price for economy class (optional)
      newBusinessPrice - the new price for business class (optional)
      newFirstPrice - the new price for first class (optional)
      newStatus - the new flight status (e.g., ON_TIME, DELAYED) (optional)
      newAirlineName - the new name of the airline (optional)
      isInternational - whether the flight is international or not (optional)

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute(FlightBookingSystem flightBookingSystem) throws FlightBookingSystemException
      Executes the update flight command. It applies all valid non-null parameters to the target flight.

      If the flight ID does not exist or the new departure date is invalid, an exception is thrown. After updating, the flight data is saved to persistent storage.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface Command
      Parameters:
      flightBookingSystem - the flight booking system instance to operate on
      Throws:
      FlightBookingSystemException - if the flight is not found or if saving data fails
